definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: Last years' almanac is useless for this year.
sentences.chinese: 去年老黄历，今年看不得。

sentences.english: And how does a westerner see each of the 12 animals in the Chinese zodiac?
sentences.chinese: 但是西方人是怎么看待中国的黄历中的十二生肖呢？

sentences.english: According to the Chinese Zodiac, 2010is the Year of the Tiger.
sentences.chinese: 根据中国的黄历，2010年是虎年。

sentences.english: Really should see Huang Li ahead going out, today's day must be disadvantageous line.
sentences.chinese: 出门之前真该看看黄历，今天的日子一定是不利出行。

sentences.english: It is said to be the oldest continuous publication known.
sentences.chinese: 据说黄历是古传的有名的出版物。

definition: variant of 黄曆|黄历[huang2 li5]
(lit.) past years' almanac/(fig.) ancient history/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
fine time, lucky day (idiom); fig. good opportunity
to break ground (prior to building sth)/to start building
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
one's birth data for astrological purposes, combined from year, month, day, hour, heavenly trunk and earthly branch
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
